sen.e: Unden Shindo-ryu is one of the ryuha (branch of a school) defining the Japanese way of tea and its ceremonial manners.
Unden Shindo school is one of the schools of Japanese tea ceremony.

sen.e: The Temae (the manner of a Japanese tea ceremony) of this ryuha has been inherited from the past until today, although the number of the disciples who try to learn its Temae has dramatically decreased in recent years.

sen.e: It is considered that the most significant characteristics of this ryuha is its simplicity.

sen.j: その由来は、千利休の道具を第一とする考え方を憂い、道具の拝見を一切排除し精神を鍛錬することに重きをおき、日常生活にこそ茶の精神が生かされなければ意味がないということからだと言われている。
sen.e: The reason of this notion comes from the idea of the way of tea defined by this ryuha, insisting on the discipline of the mind and the emphasis on the daily life for reflecting the spirit of the way of tea; the founder of this ryuha lamented the idea of SEN no Rikyu placing a great importance on the instruments used for tea ceremonies, thus the ryuha eliminated the formality of presentation and observing the tea instruments from its Temae.
